text.0: with offerings of our own we choose thee agni as invoking priest.
text.1: for sacrifice with trimmed grassat your glad carousepiercing and brightly shining thou art waxing great.
text.2: the wealthy ones adorn thee they who bring us horses as their gift.
text.3: the sprinkling ladle agniat your glad carouse and glowing offering taste thee thou art waxing great.
text.4: the holy statutes rest by thee as twere with ladles that oerflow.
text.5: black and whitegleaming coloursat your glad carouseall glories thou assurnest thou art waxing great.
text.6: o agni what thou deemest wealth victorious and immortal one.
text.7: bring thou to give us vigourat your glad carouse splendid at sacrifices thou art waxing great.
text.8: skilled in all lore is agni he whom erst atharvan brought to life.
text.9: he was vivasvāns envoy at your glad carousethe weilloved friend of yama thou art waxing great.
text.10: at sacrifices they adore thee agni when the rite proceeds.
text.11: all fair and lovely treasuresat your glad carousethou givest him who offers thou art waxing great.
text.12: men agni have established thee as welcome priest at holy rites.
text.13: thee whose face shines with butterat your glad carousebright with eyes most observant thou art waxing great.
text.14: wide and aloft thou spreadest thee o agni with thy brilliant flame.
text.15: a bull art thou when bellowingat your glad carousethou dost impregn the sisters thou art waxing great.
